content: block instructions pages 5-7 color block instructions are color coded by yarn color if you would like to edit the chart with your own color scheme you may access the chart on stitch fiddle here https //www stitchfiddle com/c/shgbdd-iqcgkp note to make your own edits you will need to make a copy of the chart to your own stitch fiddle account to do this simply click file -> create a copy if you do not yet have a stitch fiddle account you will be prompted to create one please feel free to email me at earthhandandfiber@gmail com with any questions i highly recommend importing your pattern into the my row counter app for following the pattern on your phone or tablet i have a quick overview of the app here https //youtube com/shorts/gjepsywll3o how to color change on the last stitch before the color change begin the last stitch as usual insert hook into the stitch yo and pull up a loop you should have 2 loops on the hook in the old color switch to the new color with the new color yo and pull through the 2 loops on your hook you should be left with 1 loop on your hook in the new color continue crocheting with the new color video tutorials color change on the rs https //youtube com/shorts/smx_755kxbe color change on the ws https //youtube com/shorts/jz49nw6jbna © 2025 earth hand & fiber page 3 start here color blocks begin your project with a starting chain of 51 stitches i suggest using the beige background color you plan to make your border with in my case i made my chain in white then joined the beige yarn for the last chain starting from the 2nd white background chain from your hook single_crochet across following row 1 you should have a total of 50 single_crochet by the end of the row continue by following the color block orange pumpkin instructions below continuing from row 2 brown pumpkin outlines reminder at the end of each row chain 1 and turn your work before moving on to the next row your turning chain does not count as a stitch © 2025 earth hand & fiber page 5 © 2025 earth hand & fiber page 6 © 2025 earth hand & fiber page 7 border & blocking adding a border top border join your border yarn to the upper right of your piece along the top of the tapestry i crocheted a simple pattern of single_crochet chain 1 skip pattern scalloped border for the remaining 3 sides i crocheted a scalloped border start with 2 single_crochet in the corner stitch then continue around your piece with the following repeating pattern skip 5 double_crochet in next st skip 1 single_crochet when you reach each corner place a 2 single_crochet into the corner stitch once finished fasten_off leaving a long tail ~5x the width of your piece for mounting to your dowel video tutorials top border https //youtu be/hfgueerkxco
